title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: By 2016 required and existing legislation are being enacted and applied to protect girls and boys in Southside Belize City, Stann Creek and Toledo from violence and abuse, including sexual abuse Justice officials, social workers and police officers are trained on procedures and services for children in contact with the law , and children and families in Belize, Stann Creek and Toledo are accessing targeted birth registration services, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, most excluded boys and girls in Toledo, Stann Creek, and Belize South Side are reached by policies and programmes with a gender perspective that increases protection, early childhood development, culturally-appropriate and child- friendly education and learning opportunities, across the lifecycle 0-18 including during periods of emergency

participating-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF BELIZE MINISTRY OF HE AND WELLNESS
MINISTRY OF HOME AFFAIRS AND NEW GROWTH INDUSTRIES
MINISTRY OF YOUTH SPORTS AND E GOVERNANCE

title.narrative: By 2016 required and existing legislation are being enacted and applied to protect girls and boys in Southside Belize City, StannCreek and Toledo from violence and abuse, including sexual abuse; Justice officials, social workers and police officers are trainedon procedures and services for children in contact with the law;, and children and families in Belize, Stann Creek and Toledo areaccessing targeted birth registration services

description.narrative: The Child Protection Programme continues to address social norms and behaviour that condones violent practices and ensures that impunity does not go unaddressed and unmeasured in the justice system. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2017

title.narrative: Existence of free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirements
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Prosecutors' offices and municipal courts applying child-friendly procedures
Health workers trained on birth registration
Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence, abuse and neglect
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Number of social service workers in the country
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Protection orders issued by courts for victims of domestic violence effectively implemented by police and other relevant authorities
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Data on most forms violence, exploitation and abuse of children are collected through routine administrative sources
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms
Existence of legislation that recognize children's right to be heard in civil and administrative proceedings that affect them (in line with Article 12 of the CRC)
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Justice system complies with the minimum standards laid down in the Beijing Rules of Justice
